title: Coronavirus Archives
cleaned_text:
• The Contagion Myth: The Book So Dangerous Amazon Had to Ban It Monopoly bookseller pulls #1 best-selling book claiming viruses are not contagious. Why not let the public decide for themselves?
• Half a Million Sharks Could Be Killed for CoVid 19 Vaccine GlaxoSmithKline wants to kill 500,000 sharks to use their liver oil in its first round of coronavirus vaccines
• CSA Memberships Skyrocket as Americans Remember the Value of Local Food Images of farmers dumping milk, plowing under crops and euthanizing livestock have revealed the fragility of our global food supply chain and prompted a renaissance of local, community supported agriculture.
• Attempting to keep up with school curriculum is the last thing parents, or kids, need right now, psychologist says. Both could benefit more from learning practical life-skills.
• California Fills Skate Parks with Sand. Skateboarders Shovel it Out and Keep Skating. You can take their beaches, bike paths and hiking trails, but Californians said the state went too far when it tried to take their skate parks
• Government “Gives Away” 200,000 Acres of Public Land While Americans Shelter in Place While we aren’t allowed to visit national parks and forests, the government is selling our public land off to oil and gas companies for as little as $2 an acre.
• Thousands of Acres of Fruit and Veggies are Being Left to Rot in the Fields in Florida and California With no restaurants, schools or theme parks to sell them to farmers are plowing tons of unpicked produce back into the ground
• Posting Anti-Vaccine “Propaganda” on Social Media Could Become a Crime in the U.K. Posting “false information” about vaccines on Facebook could soon land you in jail in England
